title: goerli / prater stopped recieving blocks
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: `v2022.08.02`

OS & Version: Linux

Commit hash : `35c4faa`


Our eragon/teku node has fallen off (`Payload for child of block root 0x89c728290.... was invalid` and `Fork choice missing header wth hash dc90c904fa2...`)

https://stats.goerli.net/ shows only 4 nodes active.

Last block on prater according to both `beaconcha.in` and our node is `3692511`/`115390`@`2022-08-18T10:22:22Z` (27 min ago)


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74199244/185379074-e276dbf3-b740-47b9-9786-7b6dfcba3af6.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74199244/185379338-b5023f88-08f9-4ffe-a40c-a96770ee67d9.png)

The erigon node just has this looping in the logs since the incident started:

```
INFO[08-18|11:03:48.055] [1/16 Headers] Waiting for Beacon Chain...
INFO[08-18|11:03:48.055] [1/16 Headers] Fork choice missing header with hash dc90c904fa2c2d742a23a76e044fd1174913a16620adf27544b3077a85abc48e
INFO[08-18|11:03:48.056] RPC Daemon notified of new headers       from=7426169 to=7426170 header sending=3.364µs log sending=80ns
INFO[08-18|11:03:48.056] [1/16 Headers] Waiting for Beacon Chain...
INFO[08-18|11:03:48.056] [1/16 Headers] Fork choice missing header with hash dc90c904fa2c2d742a23a76e044fd1174913a16620adf27544b3077a85abc48e
INFO[08-18|11:03:48.056] RPC Daemon notified of new headers       from=7426169 to=7426170 header sending=3.24µs log sending=79ns
```

`eth_blockNumber` RPC does not procees from `7426170`. 


----

UPDATE:

After ~50min the node was restarted. Blocks seem to pick up but there is still an ongoing fork and interruption in the consensus network and we don't have any finalization:


From the `#goerli:gitter.im` Matrix room, where this was raised:

> afr: the network status looks healthy
> afr: there are just a load of nodes not upgrade for the merge that fell behind
> 3np: Voting % is recently 80~81%. In 115389 it went down to 66.48% and we're still stuck at 115390
> 3np: what's the quorum from your end?
> afr: finalization is down due to the merge
> afr: but it does not impact the network
> afr: validators have to update their nodes and were probably not aware of the merge
A bit later the node is responding RPC results up-to-date and in sync with etherscan. So in case there is still an ongoing fork I'm not seeing it anymore.
@3nprob looks like this was a network issue that resolved? Are we good to close?

@revitteth Arguably erigon should handle a situation like this more gracefully. The `INFO` log is unmanagable and the `WARN` level isn't super insightful on its own (this is typically but far from always complemented with monitoring obv). It could easily fill up a typical setup quickly if log pruning is not in place and keeping up and a user who is not proficient at parsing them could take a while to figure out what's going on, which is not a great UX when this happens on mainnet and the user might be under pressure.
